Source code for trikit.triangle.incremental

"""
This is the incremental triangle class definition. ``IncrTriangle``
inherits from _BaseTriangle.
"""
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from . import _BaseTriangle, cumulative
from ..utils import _cumtoincr, _incrtocum




[docs]class IncrTriangle(_BaseTriangle):
    """
    Incremental triangle specification.
    """
    def __init__(self, data=None, origin=None, dev=None, value=None,
                 datafmt="incremental", trisize=None, trifmt=None):
        """
        Attempts to represent ``data`` as an incremental triangle
        instance. If ``data`` is tabular, checks ``origin``, ``dev``
        and ``value`` arguments for fieldnames corresponding to
        origin year, development period and loss amount respectively.
        If ``origin``, ``dev`` and ``value`` are unspecified,
        fieldnames are assumed to be "origin", "dev" and "value".
        """
        tri = None

        if data is not None:
            if isinstance(data, IncrTriangle):
                tri = data
            elif isinstance(data, cumulative.CumTriangle):
                tri = _cumtoincr(data)
            elif trifmt is not None:
                if trifmt.lower().startswith("i"):
                    tri = data
                elif trifmt.lower().startswith("c"):
                    tri = _cumtoincr(data)
                else:
                    raise ValueError("Invalid trifmt argument: `{}`.".format(trifmt))
            else:
                try:
                    if all(i is None for i in (origin, dev, value)):
                        origin, dev, value = "origin", "dev", "value"
                    dat_init = data[[origin, dev, value]]
                    dat_init = dat_init.groupby([origin, dev], as_index=False).sum()
                    tri_init = dat_init.pivot(index=origin, columns=dev).rename_axis(None)
                    tri_init.columns = tri_init.columns.droplevel(0)
                    if datafmt.lower().startswith("c"):
                        tri = _cumtoincr(tri_init)
                    else:
                        tri = tri_init
                except KeyError:
                    print("One or more fields not present in data.")
            # Coerce all columns to float64 type.
            for i in tri:
                tri[i] = tri[i].astype(np.float_)

            tri.columns.name = None

        super().__init__(data=tri, origin=origin, dev=dev, value=value,
                         trisize=trisize, trifmt=trifmt)
